title: Solve Quadratic Equation
aim: To solve a quadratic equation using Python.
procedure: Input coefficients a, b, and c
code:
import math

a = 1
b = -5
c = 6

d = b**2 - 4*a*c

root1 = (-b + math.sqrt(d)) / (2*a)
root2 = (-b - math.sqrt(d)) / (2*a)

print("Roots are:", root1, "and", root2)

title: Check Armstrong Number
aim: To check whether a number is an Armstrong number.
procedure: Calculate sum of digits raised to power
code:
num = 153
sum = 0
temp = num

while temp > 0:
    digit = temp % 10
    sum += digit ** 3
    temp //= 10

if sum == num:
    print("Armstrong Number")
else:
    print("Not an Armstrong Number")

aim: To find the Least Common Multiple of two numbers.

        print("LCM:", lcm)

    lcm += 1

title: Binary Search in Python
aim: To implement binary search algorithm in Python.
code:
arr = [1, 3, 5, 7, 9]
target = 7
low, high = 0, len(arr) - 1
found = False
while low <= high:
    mid = (low + high) // 2
    if arr[mid] == target:
        found = True
        break
    elif arr[mid] < target:
        low = mid + 1
    else:
        high = mid - 1
print(found)

title: Linear Search in Python
aim: To implement linear search algorithm.
code:

target = 7
found = False
for i in arr:
    if i == target:
        found = True
        break
print(found)

title: Bubble Sort in Python
aim: To sort elements using bubble sort algorithm.

title: Insertion Sort in Python
aim: To sort elements using insertion sort algorithm.
procedure: Insert each element into sorted position
code:
arr = [9, 5, 1, 4, 3]
for i in range(1, len(arr)):
    key = arr[i]
    j = i - 1
    while j >= 0 and key < arr[j]:
        arr[j + 1] = arr[j]
        j -= 1
    arr[j + 1] = key
print(arr)

title: Heap Sort in Python
aim: To sort elements using heap sort algorithm.
code:
import heapq
arr = [4, 10, 3, 5, 1]
heapq.heapify(arr)
sorted_arr = [heapq.heappop(arr) for _ in range(len(arr))]
print(sorted_arr)

title: Merge Sort in Python
aim: To sort elements using merge sort algorithm.
code:
def merge_sort(arr):
    if len(arr) > 1:
        mid = len(arr) // 2
        L = arr[:mid]
        R = arr[mid:]
        merge_sort(L)
        merge_sort(R)
        i = j = k = 0
        while i < len(L) and j < len(R):
            if L[i] < R[j]:
                arr[k] = L[i]
                i += 1
            else:
                arr[k] = R[j]
                j += 1
            k += 1
        while i < len(L):
            arr[k] = L[i]
            i += 1
            k += 1
        while j < len(R):
            arr[k] = R[j]
            j += 1
            k += 1
arr = [12, 11, 13, 5, 6, 7]
merge_sort(arr)
print(arr)

aim: To delete a node from the end of a circular linked list.

title: Delete Node from Middle of Circular Linked List
aim: To delete a node from the middle of a circular linked list.
code:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.data = data
        self.next = None
class CircularLinkedList:
    def __init__(self):
        self.head = None
    def append(self, data):
        new_node = Node(data)
        if not self.head:
            self.head = new_node
            new_node.next = self.head
            return
        temp = self.head
        while temp.next != self.head:
            temp = temp.next
        temp.next = new_node
        new_node.next = self.head
    def delete_middle(self):
        slow = self.head
        fast = self.head
        prev = None
        while fast.next != self.head and fast.next.next != self.head:
            prev = slow
            slow = slow.next
            fast = fast.next.next
        prev.next = slow.next
    def display(self):
        temp = self.head
        while True:
            print(temp.data)
            temp = temp.next
            if temp == self.head:
                break
cll = CircularLinkedList()
cll.append(1)
cll.append(2)
cll.append(3)
cll.append(4)
cll.delete_middle()
cll.display()

title: Find Maximum and Minimum in Circular Linked List
aim: To find the maximum and minimum value nodes in a circular linked list.
code:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.data = data
        self.next = None
class CircularLinkedList:
    def __init__(self):
        self.head = None
    def append(self, data):
        new_node = Node(data)
        if not self.head:
            self.head = new_node
            new_node.next = self.head
            return
        temp = self.head
        while temp.next != self.head:
            temp = temp.next
        temp.next = new_node
        new_node.next = self.head
    def find_min_max(self):
        temp = self.head
        min_val = max_val = temp.data
        while True:
            min_val = min(min_val, temp.data)
            max_val = max(max_val, temp.data)
            temp = temp.next
            if temp == self.head:
                break
        print("Min:", min_val)
        print("Max:", max_val)
cll = CircularLinkedList()
cll.append(10)
cll.append(5)
cll.append(20)
cll.find_min_max()

title: Convert Binary Tree to Doubly Linked List
aim: To convert a binary tree into a doubly linked list.
code:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.data = data
        self.left = None
        self.right = None
prev = None
head = None
def btree_to_dll(root):
    global prev, head
    if not root:
        return
    btree_to_dll(root.left)
    if prev is None:
        head = root
    else:
        root.left = prev
        prev.right = root
    prev = root
    btree_to_dll(root.right)
root = Node(2)
root.left = Node(1)
root.right = Node(3)
btree_to_dll(root)
temp = head
while temp:
    print(temp.data)
    temp = temp.right

title: Create Doubly Linked List from Ternary Tree
aim: To create a doubly linked list from a ternary tree.
code:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.data = data
        self.left = None
        self.middle = None
        self.right = None
prev = None
head = None
def ternary_to_dll(root):
    global prev, head
    if not root:
        return
    ternary_to_dll(root.left)
    if prev is None:
        head = root
    else:
        root.left = prev
        prev.right = root
    prev = root
    ternary_to_dll(root.middle)
    ternary_to_dll(root.right)
root = Node(1)
root.left = Node(2)
root.middle = Node(3)
root.right = Node(4)
ternary_to_dll(root)
temp = head
while temp:
    print(temp.data)
    temp = temp.right

title: Find Maximum and Minimum in Doubly Linked List
aim: To find maximum and minimum value nodes in a doubly linked list.
code:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.data = data
        self.prev = None
        self.next = None
class DoublyLinkedList:
    def __init__(self):
        self.head = None
    def append(self, data):
        new_node = Node(data)
        if not self.head:
            self.head = new_node
            return
        temp = self.head
        while temp.next:
            temp = temp.next
        temp.next = new_node
        new_node.prev = temp
    def find_min_max(self):
        temp = self.head
        min_val = max_val = temp.data
        while temp:
            min_val = min(min_val, temp.data)
            max_val = max(max_val, temp.data)
            temp = temp.next
        print("Min:", min_val)
        print("Max:", max_val)
dll = DoublyLinkedList()
dll.append(10)
dll.append(5)
dll.append(20)
dll.find_min_max()

title: Rotate Doubly Linked List by N Nodes
aim: To rotate a doubly linked list by N nodes.
code:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, data):
        self.data = data
        self.prev = None
        self.next = None
class DoublyLinkedList:
    def __init__(self):
        self.head = None
    def append(self, data):
        new_node = Node(data)
        if not self.head:
            self.head = new_node
            return
        temp = self.head
        while temp.next:
            temp = temp.next
        temp.next = new_node
        new_node.prev = temp
    def rotate(self, n):
        temp = self.head
        count = 1
        while count < n and temp:
            temp = temp.next
            count += 1
        if not temp:
            return
        new_head = temp.next
        if not new_head:
            return
        new_head.prev = None
        temp.next = None
        tail = new_head
        while tail.next:
            tail = tail.next
        tail.next = self.head
        self.head.prev = tail
        self.head = new_head
    def display(self):
        temp = self.head
        while temp:
            print(temp.data)
            temp = temp.next
dll = DoublyLinkedList()
dll.append(1)
dll.append(2)
dll.append(3)
dll.append(4)
dll.rotate(2)
dll.display()
